text: Has anyone worked with private npm packages and serverless functions yet? I'm having trouble figuring out how to get the .npmrc stuff working. Currently the project is failing to build due to the package not being found.

<@U05ABQULENT> one possible workaround I have done in past is to use a github private repo and passing the token in the URL. May or may not work for you but could be a patch. Also I use TS and esbuild to transpile and you can select whether a package gets transpiled at same time or not

Oh sweet, I didn't know you could do that! I'm currently hosting it as a packed tar file in s3, but github with a token would be more ideal.

Thanks!
There has been GH changes in how they do stuff so hopefully that still works. Not 100% sure

Also... I personally use TypeScript for my app.functions and run esbuild to transpile the code - I specifically have to tell it to not include any external packages since HS will read and load the npm packages but you could pick and choose and transpile your private one for ex
I scheduled a call for Friday
